Authors: Jian-Kui Liu, Ya-Ya Chen, Asha Janadaree Dissanayake
Title:
Additions to Karst Fungi 5: Sardiniella guizhouensis sp. nov.
(Botryosphaeriaceae) associated with woody hosts in Guizhou province,
China
Keywords:
1 new taxon, asexual morph, Dothideomycetes, Phylogeny,
Sexual morph, Taxonomy.
Abstract:
We are participating in an investigation of ascomycetous
fungi in Karst formations of the Asian region. Three isolates were
obtained from dead aerial stems of unknown hosts in three locations in
Guizhou province, China. Though morphology assigned it to be a typical
botryosphaeriaceous species, a phylogenetic analyses based on a combined
DNA dataset of large subunit (LSU), internal transcribed spacer (ITS)
and a part of the elongation factor 1-α (tef) gene were carried out to
justify their placement within Botryosphaeriaceae. The phylogenetic
result verified that three isolates of the present collection formed a
well-supported monotypic clade within the genus Sardiniella, and can be
recognized as a distinct lineage. Hence, the new collection is
identified as Sardiniella guizhouensis sp. nov. by providing detailed
descriptions and illustrations of both sexual and asexual morphs. This
is the first study which reveal the sexual morph of the genus
Sardiniella, and the genus is characterized with 24(6)-spored asci. The
investigations of Sardiniella species in both tropical and temperate
regions are still needed as many novelties remain to be discovered.
